description: This schema describes version 20210928 of the OURZ Metadata Standard
title: Ourz20210928

display_type.description: A field indicating how the `value` data should be displayed. Defaults to 'string'

account.description: Contributor/SplitRecipient's Ethereum wallet address converted to lowercase

role.description: Contributor/SplitRecipient's role in the creation of the NFT

name.description: The name or title of the Media

examples: This is the result of collaboration.

collection_title.decription: The title of the collection this NFT belongs to, if any

category.description: The genre and medium of the cryptomedia, if applicable

medium.description: The material and/or tools used by the creator(s) to create the cryptomedia

split_recipients.description: Royalty information for the Split Contract that minted the cryptomedia

version.description: This property defines the calendar version of the schema so that consumers can correctly parse the json

image.description: An optional preview image URL for the media

external_url.description: This property defines an optional external URL that can reference a webpage or external asset for the NFT

animation_url.description: A URL to a multi-media attachment for the item. The file extensions GLTF, GLB, WEBM, MP4, M4V, OGV, and OGG are supported, along with the audio-only extensions MP3, WAV, and OGA. Animation_url also supports HTML pages, allowing you to build rich experiences using JavaScript canvas, WebGL, and more. Access to browser extensions is not supported

copyright_info.description: Fields pertaining to copyright & licensing, optional

copyright_holder.description: The party (organization or person) holding the legal copyright to the cryptomedia.

copyright_year.description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the cryptomedia was first asserted.

copyright_notice.description: Text of a notice appropriate for describing the copyright aspects of this cryptomedia, ideally indicating the owner of the copyright for the media.
examples:
Exclusive right of commercial use - TA-ECU - https://en.tokenart.org/licence 
 The commercial use is Exclusively represented by one or more NFT that creator (Big Picture Studios) creates and only the NFT owner can exploit it. This means that once creatorâ€™s NFT is sold the creator prevent himself to use his artwork for commercial use. 
 It can be mixed with : CC-BY-NC ; CC-BY-NC-SA ; CC-BY-NC-ND

license.description: A license document that applies to the cryptomedia, typically indicated by URL.

is_family_friendly.description: Indicates whether this cryptomedia is family friendly.

attributes.description: This property defines any additional attributes for the item; see https://schema.org/CreativeWork for ideas
